Autobianchi was an Italian make and were imported in France by André Chardonnet.
Beside Autobianchi, Chardonnet was also the official distributer for  Véritas, AC, Bristol, Neckar, Siata, Fiat Polski/FSO, Zastava/Yugo, Lancia, ARO, Maruti, Bertone et Maserati.
What is the relation between Citroen and Autobianchi / Chardonnet ?
At one point Chardonnet stroke a deal with Citroen to have Autobianchi sold by the whole Citroen garage network.
My Father was a Citroen garage owner in France and he sold and bought back used Autobianchi A112.
My mum drove succesively 2 Autobianchi A112 around 1974-1976.
My bother Pierre and sister Caroline had the plaisure to be passenger of this type of car.
For nostalgia reason I imported an early A112 (serie 1, same color as in the add) and would like to visite Saratoga for the first time and share Citroen stories with my friends and meet new one.
I'm the second owner of this particular car and I have the original "bon de commande" from a Citroen dealer.
It is not a Citroen but it has a small link to Citroen history.

Built by a Parisian racer for off-road racing in North Africa, this is an eight cylinder 2CV, as it has one GS engine in the front and another in the rear.  Sectioned 100mm, with a full roll cage and gas tanks instead of rear seats, this has been transformed from a slow snail to an angry arachnid.  Restored to it's original racing livery, it proudly and appropriately displays it's first sponsor's name: Coup de Coeur, which means  literally "heart attack," or colloquially "love at first sight."

First-year Insight in rare Citrus Yellow color. Original owner car. One of the things that influenced my decision to buy it was the rear wheel covers, which reminded me of Citroëns (I once owned a 1959 2CV).
Original, unrestored, just maintained and a daily driver.

Ravine find 1956 DS19, first yr production, VIN 10650, if history is correct, was ordered during first day of Oct '55 Paris auto show introduction.  35K orig. miles, has all sorts of prototype details that were changed quickly to fix problems, lower cost, make them easier to service.  Hope to document as many details as possible for meet.  Will show it as found as near as possible.
I'm bringing Marc Levensen's car as a favor to Jo Anne Murray, his wife.
D Special - Once owned by NYC artist David Hammons. I surprised my father, Alan, with this special car for his 70th birthday and 10 year anniversary of his near fatal heart attack.

I grew up in Italy. I moved to the USA 12 years ago. My uncle, in Italy, owned a Citroen dealership and my dad has always owned Citroen. I learned how to drive in the 2CV of my mother and I spent so many afternoons sitting in the Ds, SM, Xm that were. parked in the backyard of my uncle's dealership. 

For my 40th birthday, 10th February 2021, I decided to give myself a huge present: a SM. I found the car in northwest of Italy (Turin) and bought it  on February 9th 2021 from its second owner without having the possibility to seeing it personally. As always, in the world of classic car, we have the privilege to meet amazing people and I asked the president of the Italian SM Owner club - who I met via email - to see the car for me before purchasing it. I have also sent all the pics and video of the car to Dave Burnham who assisted me with the puchasing. After completing the deal, I moved the car to Padova - Italy - to complete the interior refurbishment by Fabrizio Libera, a well respected Citroen specialist in Italy . I saved the original black leather seats but bought a complete new set of brown Forgione's leather seats and carpet. Upgrade the radio to Continetal Edison and clean a lot of non original details that have been added throughout the years. I then got in touch with Erik De Widt and spent several hours in organizing the transfer to the USA. Finally the SM was shipped out of Amsterdam to Baltimore where I had the pleasure to meet her for few hours. Due to Burnham's busy scheduled, I was directed to David Hume who took my car for the extra care in the engine compartment. A lot of more works that expected was needed but finally the SM is ready. David offered to ship the car to the 2022 Citroen Rendezvous so I can pick it up from there and drive it back to Philly area where I live. I found the idea amazing, called my dad in Italy, bought a ticket for him to travel here in the USA and pick the car together with my daughter at the Rendezvous. This is the best way to celebrate father's day! Thanks Rendezvous. It will be my first one but for sure one of the most special one for me. 

About the car: Citroen SM 1972 for Italian Market. In AC 525 with brown leather interior and a lot of original details.
